Heidi M Hurst

Build what is beautiful and good.

Mathematician and Computer Scientist

Quantitative tools to address challenging questions. BA in Applied Mathematics, experience in software development and engineering for government clients. Current MSc student in Mathematical Modelling and Scientific Computing.

Geospatial Analyst

Using interdisciplinary skills drawn from computer science, maths, and geography to look at the world around us and probe the where, why, and how of spatial data. MSc in Geographic Information Science.

Dream Big

The world is full of big problems and vast amounts of data. To solve concerns of the future, we'll need to know how - and when - to address the one with the other.

Do Good

Anything worth doing is worth doing well - and with anything and everything, do good.

My Work

Currently, I am studying for my MSc in Mathematical Modelling and Scientific Computing at Oxford University.

I recently completed my MSc in GIS at University College London, where I completed a dissertation on the impact of resolution on vehicle detection in satellite imagery using convolutional neural networks (machine learning). Previously I've supported emergency management and government clients.

Poster, full dissertation, and repository. Additional MSc coursework available here.
